component.description:
Extends standard commandButton by user role support.
Unless otherwise specified, all attributes accept static values or EL expressions.

set.name: id
set.description: The developer-assigned ID of this component. The ID must be unique within the scope of the tag's enclosing naming container (e.g. h:form or f:subview). This value must be a static value.

set.name: immediate
set.description: A boolean value that identifies the phase during which action events should fire. During normal event processing, action methods and action listener methods are fired during the "invoke application" phase of request processing. If this attribute is set to "true", these methods are fired instead at the end of the "apply request values" phase.

set.name: action
set.description: A method binding EL expression that identifies an action method to be invoked if this component is activated by the user. An action method accepts no parameters and has a String return value, called the action outcome, that identifies the next view displayed. The phase that this event is fired in can be controlled via the immediate attribute.

set.name: actionListener
set.description: A method binding EL expression that identifies an action listener method to be invoked if this component is activated by the user. An action listener method accepts a parameter of type javax.faces.event.ActionEvent and returns void. The phase that this event is fired in can be controlled via the immediate attribute.

set.name: value
set.description: The initial value of this component.

set.name: dir
set.description: HTML: The direction of text display, either 'ltr' (left-to-right) or 'rtl' (right-to-left).

set.name: lang
set.description: HTML: The base language of this document.

set.name: style
set.description: HTML: CSS styling instructions.

set.name: title
set.description: HTML: An advisory title for this element. Often used by the user agent as a tooltip.

set.name: styleClass
set.description: The CSS class for this element. Corresponds to the HTML 'class' attribute.

set.name: onclick
set.description: HTML: Script to be invoked when the element is clicked.

set.name: ondblclick
set.description: HTML: Script to be invoked when the element is double-clicked.

set.name: onmousedown
set.description: HTML: Script to be invoked when the pointing device is pressed over this element.

set.name: onmouseup
set.description: HTML: Script to be invoked when the pointing device is released over this element.

set.name: onmouseover
set.description: HTML: Script to be invoked when the pointing device is moved into this element.

set.name: onmousemove
set.description: HTML: Script to be invoked when the pointing device is moved while it is in this element.

set.name: onmouseout
set.description: HTML: Script to be invoked when the pointing device is moves out of this element.

set.name: onkeypress
set.description: HTML: Script to be invoked when a key is pressed over this element.

set.name: onkeydown
set.description: HTML: Script to be invoked when a key is pressed down over this element.

set.name: onkeyup
set.description: HTML: Script to be invoked when a key is released over this element.

set.name: accesskey
set.description: HTML: Sets the access key for this element.

set.name: alt
set.description: HTML: Specifies alternative text that can be used by a browser that can't show this element.

set.name: disabled
set.description: HTML: When true, this element cannot receive focus.

set.name: onblur
set.description: HTML: Specifies a script to be invoked when the element loses focus.

set.name: onfocus
set.description: HTML: Specifies a script to be invoked when the element receives focus.

set.name: onselect
set.description: HTML: Specifies a script to be invoked when the element is selected.

set.name: onchange
set.description: HTML: Specifies a script to be invoked when the element is modified.

set.name: tabindex
set.description: HTML: Specifies the position of this element within the tab order of the document.

set.name: type
set.description: HTML: A hint to the user agent about the content type of the linked resource.

set.name: size
set.description: The initial width of this control.

set.name: image
set.description: HTML: The URL of an image that renders in place of the button.

set.name: enabledOnUserRole
set.description: If user is in given role, this component will be rendered normally. If not, no hyperlink is rendered but all nested tags (=body) are rendered.

set.name: visibleOnUserRole
set.description: If user is in given role, this component will be rendered normally. If not, nothing is rendered and the body of this tag will be skipped.

set.name: forceId
set.description: If true, this component will force the use of the specified id when rendering.

set.name: forceIdIndex
set.description: If false, this component will not append a '[n]' suffix (where 'n' is the row index) to components that are contained within a "list." This value will be true by default and the value will be ignored if the value of forceId is false (or not specified.)

set.name: actionFor
set.description: Comma separated list of subForm-ids for which validation and model update should take place when this command is executed. You need to wrap your input components in org.apache.myfaces.custom.subform.SubForm instances for this to work.

component.description:
Extended data_table that adds some additional features to the standard data_table action: see attribute descriptions for preserveDataModel, sortColumn, sortAscending and preserveSort.
Unless otherwise specified, all attributes accept static values or EL expressions.

set.name: id
set.description: The developer-assigned ID of this component. The ID must be unique within the scope of the tag's enclosing naming container (e.g. h:form or f:subview). This value must be a static value.

set.name: columnClasses
set.description: A comma separated list of CSS class names to apply to td elements in each column.

set.name: footerClass
set.description: The CSS class to be applied to footer cells.

set.name: headerClass
set.description: The CSS class to be applied to header cells.

set.name: rowClasses
set.description: A comma separated list of CSS class names to apply to td elements in each row.

set.name: dir
set.description: HTML: The direction of text display, either 'ltr' (left-to-right) or 'rtl' (right-to-left).

set.name: lang
set.description: HTML: The base language of this document.

set.name: style
set.description: HTML: CSS styling instructions.

set.name: title
set.description: HTML: An advisory title for this element. Often used by the user agent as a tooltip.

set.name: styleClass
set.description: The CSS class for this element. Corresponds to the HTML 'class' attribute.

set.name: onclick
set.description: HTML: Script to be invoked when the element is clicked.

set.name: ondblclick
set.description: HTML: Script to be invoked when the element is double-clicked.

set.name: onmousedown
set.description: HTML: Script to be invoked when the pointing device is pressed over this element.

set.name: onmouseup
set.description: HTML: Script to be invoked when the pointing device is released over this element.

set.name: onmouseover
set.description: HTML: Script to be invoked when the pointing device is moved into this element.

set.name: onmousemove
set.description: HTML: Script to be invoked when the pointing device is moved while it is in this element.

set.name: onmouseout
set.description: HTML: Script to be invoked when the pointing device is moves out of this element.

set.name: onkeypress
set.description: HTML: Script to be invoked when a key is pressed over this element.

set.name: onkeydown
set.description: HTML: Script to be invoked when a key is pressed down over this element.

set.name: onkeyup
set.description: HTML: Script to be invoked when a key is released over this element.

set.name: align
set.description: HTML: Specifies the horizontal alignment of this element. Deprecated in HTML 4.01.

set.name: border
set.description: HTML: Specifies the width of the border of this element, in pixels. Deprecated in HTML 4.01.

set.name: bgcolor
set.description: HTML: The background color of this element.

set.name: datafld
set.description: Reserved for future use.

set.name: datasrc
set.description: Reserved for future use.

set.name: dataformatas
set.description: Reserved for future use.

set.name: cellpadding
set.description: HTML: Specifies the amount of empty space between the cell border and its contents. It can be either a pixel length or a percentage.

set.name: cellspacing
set.description: HTML: Specifies the amount of space between the cells of the table. It can be either a pixel length or a percentage of available space.

set.name: frame
set.description: HTML: Controls what part of the frame that surrounds a table is visible. Values include: void, above, below, hsides, lhs, rhs, vsides, box, and border.

set.name: rules
set.description: HTML: Controls how rules are rendered between cells. Values include: none, groups, rows, cols, and all.

set.name: summary
set.description: HTML: Provides a summary of the contents of the table, for accessibility purposes.

set.name: width
set.description: HTML: Specifies the desired width of the table, as a pixel length or a percentage of available space.

set.name: value
set.description:
An EL expression that specifies the data model that backs this table. The value can be of any type.
A value of type DataModel is used directly. Array-like parameters of type java.util.List, array of Object, java.sql.ResultSet, or javax.servlet.jsp.jstl.sql.Result are wrapped in a DataModel.
Other values are wrapped in a DataModel as a single row.

set.name: var
set.description: Defines the name of the request-scope variable that will hold the current row during iteration. This value must be a static value.

set.name: rows
set.description: The number of rows to be displayed. Specify zero for all remaining rows in the table.

set.name: first
set.description: The index of the first row to be displayed, where 0 is the first row.

set.name: preserveDataModel
set.description:
Indicates whether the state of the whole DataModel should be saved and restored. When set to false, the value-binding for the "value" attribute of this table is executed each time the page is rendered. When set to true, that value-binding is only executed when the component is first created, and the DataModel state is thereafter saved/restored automatically by the component.
When column sorting is used for a table this property needs to be false so that the DataModel can be updated to reflect any changes in the sort criteria.
Default: false

set.name: preserveRowStates
set.description:
Indicates whether the state for each row should not be discarded before the datatable is rendered again. Setting this to true might be hepful if an input component inside the datatable has no valuebinding and the value entered in there should be displayed again. This will only work reliable if the datamodel of the datatable did not change either by sorting, removing or adding rows.
Default: false

set.name: forceIdIndexFormula
set.description: A formula that overrides the default row index in the construction of table's body components. Example : #{myRowVar.key} Warning, the EL should evaluate to a unique value for each row !

set.name: sortColumn
set.description: Value reference to a model property that gives the current sort column name. The target String property is set to the "columnName" of whichever column has been chosen to sort by, and the method which is bound to the "value" attribute of this table (ie which provides the DataModel used) is expected to use this property to determine how to sort the DataModel's contents.

set.name: sortAscending
set.description: Value reference to a model property that gives the current sort direction. The target Boolean property is set to true when the selected sortColumn should be sorted in ascending order, and false otherwise. The method which is bound to the "value" attribute of this table (ie which provides the DataModel used) is expected to use this property to determine how to sort the DataModel's contents.

set.name: preserveSort
set.description: Indicates whether the state of the sortColumn and sortAscending attribute should be saved and restored and written back to the model during the update model phase. Default: true

set.name: renderedIfEmpty
set.description: Indicates whether this table should be rendered if the underlying DataModel is empty. You could as well use rendered="#{not empty bean.list}", but this one causes the getList method of your model bean beeing called up to five times per request, which is not optimal when the list is backed by a DB table. Using renderedIfEmpty="false" solves this problem, because the MyFaces extended HtmlDataTable automatically caches the DataModel and calles the model getter only once per request. Default: true

set.name: rowIndexVar
set.description: A parameter name, under which the current rowIndex is set in request scope similar to the var parameter.

set.name: rowCountVar
set.description: A parameter name, under which the rowCount is set in request scope similar to the var parameter.

set.name: previousRowDataVar
set.description: A parameter name, under which the previous RowData Object is set in request scope similar to the rowIndexVar and rowCountVar parameters. Mind that the value of this request scope attribute is null in the first row or when isRowAvailable returns false for the previous row.

set.name: sortedColumnVar
set.description: A parameter name, under which the a boolean is set in request scope similar to the var parameter. TRUE for the column that is currently sorted, FALSE otherwise.

set.name: rowOnClick
set.description: Defines a JavaScript onclick event handler for each table row

set.name: rowOnDblClick
set.description: Defines a JavaScript ondblclick event handler for each table row

set.name: rowOnMouseDown
set.description: Defines a JavaScript onmpusedown event handler for each table row

set.name: rowOnMouseUp
set.description: Defines a JavaScript onmouseup event handler for each table row

set.name: rowOnMouseOver
set.description: Defines a JavaScript onmouseover event handler for each table row

set.name: rowOnMouseMove
set.description: Defines a JavaScript onmousemove event handler for each table row

set.name: rowOnMouseOut
set.description: Defines a JavaScript onmouseout event handler for each table row

set.name: rowOnKeyPress
set.description: Defines a JavaScript onkeypress event handler for each table row

set.name: rowOnKeyDown
set.description: Defines a JavaScript onkeydown event handler for each table row

set.name: rowOnKeyUp
set.description: Defines a JavaScript onkeyup event handler for each table row

set.name: rowId
set.description: The id to use for <tr> elements that are generated by the table.

set.name: rowStyleClass
set.description: Corresponds to the HTML class attribute for the row tr tag.

set.name: rowStyle
set.description: Corresponds to the HTML style attribute for the row tr tag.

set.name: rowGroupStyle
set.description: Corresponds to the HTML style attribute for grouped rows.

set.name: rowGroupStyleClass
set.description: StyleClass for grouped rows.

set.name: varDetailToggler
set.description: This variable has the boolean property "currentdetailExpanded" which is true if the current detail row is expanded and the action method "toggleDetail" which expand/collapse the current detail row.

set.name: forceId
set.description: If true, this component will force the use of the specified id when rendering.

set.name: forceIdIndex
set.description: If false, this component will not append a '[n]' suffix (where 'n' is the row index) to components that are contained within a "list." This value will be true by default and the value will be ignored if the value of forceId is false (or not specified.)

set.name: enabledOnUserRole
set.description: If user is in given role, this component will be rendered normally. If not, no hyperlink is rendered but all nested tags (=body) are rendered.

set.name: visibleOnUserRole
set.description: If user is in given role, this component will be rendered normally. If not, nothing is rendered and the body of this tag will be skipped.

set.name: newspaperColumns
set.description: The number of columns to wrap the table over. Default: 1

component.description:
Extends standard inputHidden by providing additional MyFaces goodies.
Unless otherwise specified, all attributes accept static values or EL expressions.

set.name: id
set.description: The developer-assigned ID of this component. The ID must be unique within the scope of the tag's enclosing naming container (e.g. h:form or f:subview). This value must be a static value.

set.name: value
set.description: The initial value of this component.

set.name: converter
set.description:
An expression that specifies the Converter for this component. If the value binding expression is a String, the String is used as an ID to look up a Converter. If the value binding expression is a Converter, uses that instance as the converter.
The value can either be a static value (ID case only) or an EL expression.

set.name: immediate
set.description: A boolean value that identifies the phase during which value change events should fire. During normal event processing, value change events are fired during the "invoke application" phase of request processing. If this attribute is set to "true", these methods are fired instead at the end of the "apply request values" phase.

set.name: required
set.description: A boolean value that indicates whether an input value is required. If this value is true, and no input value is provided, the error message javax.faces.component.UIInput.REQUIRED is posted.

set.name: validator
set.description: A method binding EL expression, accepting FacesContext, UIComponent, and Object parameters, and returning void, that validates the component's local value.

set.name: valueChangeListener
set.description: A method binding EL expression, accepting a ValueChangeEvent parameter and returning void. The specified method is invoked if this component is modified. The phase that this handler is fired in can be controlled via the immediate attribute.

set.name: forceId
set.description: If true, this component will force the use of the specified id when rendering.

set.name: forceIdIndex
set.description: If false, this component will not append a '[n]' suffix (where 'n' is the row index) to components that are contained within a "list." This value will be true by default and the value will be ignored if the value of forceId is false (or not specified.)

set.description: If false, this component will not append a '[n]' suffix (where 'n' is the row index) to components that are contained within a "list." This value will be true by default and the value will be ignored if the value of forceId is false (or not specified.)

set.name: summaryFormat
set.description: If present, instead of rendering the message summary, a MessageFormat with this attribute as pattern is created. The format method of this MessageFormat is called with the message summary as the first argument and the label of the associated component (if any) as the second argument. Example: "{0}:"

set.name: detailFormat
set.description: If present, instead of rendering the message detail, a MessageFormat with this attribute as pattern is created. The format method of this MessageFormat is called with the message detail as the first argument and the label of the associated component (if any) as the second argument. Example: "The input in field {1} is wrong: {0}"

set.name: replaceIdWithLabel
set.description: If present, all occurrences of the id of the component for which the message is rendered will be replaced by the label. Default: true.

set.name: forceSpan
set.description: If set to true, an empty span element is rendered. Useful if there is an inputAjax field and the corresponding error message is displayed there.

set.name: warnClass
set.description: CSS class to be used for messages with severity "WARN".

set.description: CSS style to be used for messages with severity "WARN".

set.name: errorClass
set.description: CSS class to be used for messages with severity "ERROR".

set.name: errorStyle
set.description: CSS style to be used for messages with severity "ERROR".

set.name: fatalClass
set.description: CSS class to be used for messages with severity "FATAL".

set.name: fatalStyle
set.description: CSS style to be used for messages with severity "FATAL".

set.name: layout
set.description: The layout: "table" or "list". Default: list

set.name: tooltip
set.description: If true, the message summary will be rendered as a tooltip (i.e. HTML title attribute).

set.name: enabledOnUserRole
set.description: If user is in given role, this component will be rendered normally. If not, no hyperlink is rendered but all nested tags (=body) are rendered.

set.name: visibleOnUserRole
set.description: If user is in given role, this component will be rendered normally. If not, nothing is rendered and the body of this tag will be skipped.

set.name: forceId
set.description: If true, this component will force the use of the specified id when rendering.

set.name: forceIdIndex
set.description: If false, this component will not append a '[n]' suffix (where 'n' is the row index) to components that are contained within a "list." This value will be true by default and the value will be ignored if the value of forceId is false (or not specified.)

set.name: summaryFormat
set.description: If present, instead of rendering the message summary, a MessageFormat with this attribute as pattern is created. The format method of this MessageFormat is called with the message summary as the first argument and the label of the associated component (if any) as the second argument. Example: "{0}:" or "{0} in field {1}"

set.name: globalSummaryFormat
set.description: Like summaryFormat, but applies to global messages (i.e. messages not associated with a component). If no globalSummaryFormat is given, the summaryFormat is used for global messages. Example: "{0}:"

set.name: detailFormat
set.description: If present, instead of rendering the message detail, a MessageFormat with this attribute as pattern is created. The format method of this MessageFormat is called with the message detail as the first argument and the label of the associated component (if any) as the second argument. Example: "The input in field {1} is wrong: {0}"

set.name: replaceIdWithLabel
set.description: If present, all occurrences of the id of the component for which the message is rendered will be replaced by the label.

set.name: forceSpan
set.description: If set to true, an empty span element is rendered. Useful if there are a few inputAjax fields on the same page and the corresponding error messages should be shown on one central place.

component.description:

component.description:
Provides a calendar.
Unless otherwise specified, all attributes accept static values or EL expressions.

set.name: id
set.description: The developer-assigned ID of this component. The ID must be unique within the scope of the tag's enclosing naming container (e.g. h:form or f:subview). This value must be a static value.

set.name: value
set.description: The initial value of this component.

set.name: converter
set.description:
An expression that specifies the Converter for this component. If the value binding expression is a String, the String is used as an ID to look up a Converter. If the value binding expression is a Converter, uses that instance as the converter.
The value can either be a static value (ID case only) or an EL expression.

set.name: immediate
set.description: A boolean value that identifies the phase during which value change events should fire. During normal event processing, value change events are fired during the "invoke application" phase of request processing. If this attribute is set to "true", these methods are fired instead at the end of the "apply request values" phase.

set.name: required
set.description: A boolean value that indicates whether an input value is required. If this value is true, and no input value is provided, the error message javax.faces.component.UIInput.REQUIRED is posted.

set.name: validator
set.description: A method binding EL expression, accepting FacesContext, UIComponent, and Object parameters, and returning void, that validates the component's local value.

set.name: valueChangeListener
set.description: A method binding EL expression, accepting a ValueChangeEvent parameter and returning void. The specified method is invoked if this component is modified. The phase that this handler is fired in can be controlled via the immediate attribute.

set.description: If user is in given role, this component will be rendered normally. If not, no hyperlink is rendered but all nested tags (=body) are rendered.

set.name: monthYearRowClass
set.description: CSS class to be used on the TR element for the header-row showing month and year.

set.name: weekRowClass
set.description: CSS class to be used on the TR element for the header-row showing the week-days.

set.name: dayCellClass
set.description: CSS class to be used for the TD element containing a day days.

set.name: currentDayCellClass
set.description: CSS class to be used for the TD element of the currently selected date.

set.name: renderAsPopup
set.description: Render the input-calendar as a java-script popup on client.

set.name: popupLeft
set.description: Render the input-calendar left of the button, not right like normally done.

set.name: addResources
set.description: Automatically add the input-calendar scripts and css files to the header - set that to false to provide the scripts yourself.

set.name: popupDateFormat
set.description: Defines the date format used by the java-script popup on client.

set.name: popupButtonString
set.description: Defines the string displayed on the button which leads to the calendar-popup-window (... by default).

set.name: popupButtonStyle
set.description: Defines the css style for the button which leads to the calendar-popup-window.

set.name: popupButtonStyleClass
set.description: Defines the css style class for the button which leads to the calendar-popup-window.

set.name: popupGotoString
set.description: Set the string for "Go To Current Month"

set.name: popupTodayString
set.description: Set the string for "Today is"

set.name: popupTodayDateFormat
set.description: Defines the date format used by the java-script popup on client for the today-is string.

set.name: popupWeekString
set.description: Set the string for "Wk"

set.name: popupScrollLeftMessage
set.description: Set the string for scrolling to the left.

set.name: popupScrollRightMessage
set.description: Set the string for scrolling to the right.

set.name: popupSelectMonthMessage
set.description: Set the string for "Click to select a month".

set.name: popupSelectYearMessage
set.description: Set the string for "Click to select a year".

set.name: popupSelectDateMessage
set.description: Set the string for "Select [date] as date" (do not replace [date], it will be replaced by the current date).

set.name: popupTheme
set.description: Set the theme-prefix for this component.

set.name: popupButtonImageUrl
set.description: Url to the image for this popupButton.

set.name: renderPopupButtonAsImage
set.description: If true, renders a calendar icon instead of the button to pop up the calendar.

set.name: helpText
set.description: The text that will be rendered in the field - helping the user to find the right format to enter into the field.

set.name: javascriptLocation
set.description: An alternate location to find javascript resources. If no values is specified, javascript will be loaded from the resources directory using AddResource and ExtensionsFilter.

set.name: imageLocation
set.description: An alternate location to find image resources. If no values is specified, images will be loaded from the resources directory using AddResource and ExtensionsFilter.

set.name: styleLocation
set.description: An alternate location to find stylesheet resources. If no values is specified, stylesheets will be loaded from the resources directory using AddResource and ExtensionsFilter.

set.description: If true, renders only the value of the component, but no input widget. Default is false.

set.description: Style used when displayValueOnly is true.

set.description: Style class used when displayValueOnly is true.

component.description:
Setting a value from the model in java-script so that it can be used (e.g. by the value change listener) afterwards.
Unless otherwise specified, all attributes accept static values or EL expressions.

Renders a HTML input of type "checkbox". The associated SelectItem comes from an extended selectManyCheckbox component with layout "spread". The selectManyCheckbox is referenced by the "for" attribute. All HTML pass-through attributes for this input are taken from the associated selectManyCheckbox.
Unless otherwise specified, all attributes accept static values or EL expressions.

set.name: id
set.description: The developer-assigned ID of this component. The ID must be unique within the scope of the tag's enclosing naming container (e.g. h:form or f:subview). This value must be a static value.

set.description: If user is in given role, this component will be rendered normally. If not, no hyperlink is rendered but all nested tags (=body) are rendered.

set.name: visibleOnUserRole
set.description: If user is in given role, this component will be rendered normally. If not, nothing is rendered and the body of this tag will be skipped.

set.name: for
set.description: id of the referenced extended selectManyCheckbox component

set.name: index
set.description: n-th SelectItem of referenced UISelectMany starting with 0.

component.description:
Clickable sort column header. Must be nested inside an extended data_table tag. This tag is derived from the standard command_link tag and has the additional attributes columnName and arrow. Note: In contrast to normal command links, the default for the "immediate" attribute is "true". This is desirable as it avoids validating all input fields in the enclosing form when the column sort order changes. HOWEVER when the table contains input components "immediate" must be set to false; otherwise input fields will render blank after a sort, or will show their old values (ie will not appear to sort though output fields in the table will sort) when sort ordering is changed.
Unless otherwise specified, all attributes accept static values or EL expressions.

set.description: A boolean value that identifies the phase during which action events should fire. During normal event processing, action methods and action listener methods are fired during the "invoke application" phase of request processing. If this attribute is set to "true", these methods are fired instead at the end of the "apply request values" phase.

An action method accepts no parameters and has a String return value, called the action outcome, that identifies the next view displayed. The phase that this event is fired in can be controlled via the immediate attribute.

set.name: columnName
set.description: The name of this column. This name must uniquely identify this column among all other (sortable) columns in the same data_table. The sortColumn attribute of the embedding data_table reflects the current sort column (see extended data_table).

set.name: propertyName
set.description: The property name associated with this column. This name must be one of the properties of the row object by which the sorting should be performed. The sortProperty attribute of the embedding data_table reflects the current sort property (see extended data_table).

set.name: arrow
set.description: Indicates whether an arrow, that shows the sort direction should be rendered. Default: false

set.name: layout
set.description:
simple|unorderedList|orderedList
  • simple = for each dataRow all children are simply rendered
  • unorderedList = the list is rendered as HTML unordered list (= bullet list)
  • orderedList = the list is rendered as HTML ordered list
Default: simple

component.description:
Scroller for UIData components eg. dataTable Must be nested inside footer facet of dataTable OR for attribute must be given so that corresponding uiData can be found.
Unless otherwise specified, all attributes accept static values or EL expressions.

set.name: id
set.description: The developer-assigned ID of this component. The ID must be unique within the scope of the tag's enclosing naming container (e.g. h:form or f:subview). This value must be a static value.

set.name: enabledOnUserRole
set.description: If user is in given role, this component will be rendered normally. If not, no hyperlink is rendered but all nested tags (=body) are rendered.

set.name: visibleOnUserRole
set.description: If user is in given role, this component will be rendered normally. If not, nothing is rendered and the body of this tag will be skipped.

set.name: for
set.description: The JSF id of a UIData component that this scroller will affect. If this attribute is not present then the datascroller must be a child of a UIData comopnent.

set.name: fastStep
set.description: step (pages) used for fastforward and fastrewind

set.name: pageIndexVar
set.description: A parameter name, under which the actual page index is set in request scope similar to the var parameter.

set.name: pageCountVar
set.description: A parameter name, under which the actual page count is set in request scope similar to the var parameter.

set.name: rowsCountVar
set.description: A parameter name, under which the actual rows count is set in request scope similar to the var parameter.

set.name: displayedRowsCountVar
set.description: A parameter name, under which the actual displayed rows count is set in request scope similar to the var parameter.

set.name: firstRowIndexVar
set.description: A parameter name, under which the actual first displayed row index is set in request scope similar to the var parameter.

set.name: lastRowIndexVar
set.description: A parameter name, under which the actual last displayed row index is set in request scope similar to the var parameter.

set.name: styleClass
set.description: styleClass for scroller table

set.name: style
set.description: style for scroller table

set.name: paginator
set.description: If set true, then the paginator gets rendered

set.name: paginatorMaxPages
set.description: The maximum amount of pages to be displayed in the paginator.

set.name: paginatorTableClass
set.description: styleclass for pagingator

set.name: paginatorTableStyle
set.description: style for pagingator

set.name: paginatorColumnClass
set.description: styleClass for paginator's column

set.name: paginatorColumnStyle
set.description: style for paginator's column

set.name: paginatorActiveColumnClass
set.description: styleClass for paginator's column with pageIndex = currentPageIndex

set.name: paginatorActiveColumnStyle
set.description: style for paginator's column with pageIndex = currentPageIndex

set.name: renderFacetsIfSinglePage
set.description: If set to false, the facets aren't renderd if all the lines are contained on a single page. Default is true.

set.name: immediate
set.description: True means that the default ActionListener should be executed immediately (i.e. during Apply Request Values phase of the request processing lifecycle), rather than waiting until the Invoke Application phase.

set.name: actionListener
set.description: MethodBinding pointing at method acception an ActionEvent with return type void.

component.description:
An inline HTML based word processor based on the Kupu library. See http://kupu.oscom.org Right now, the support is limited to one editor per page (but you can use tabs to have multiple editors, but only one rendered at a time).
Unless otherwise specified, all attributes accept static values or EL expressions.

set.name: id

set.name: value
set.description: The initial value of this component.

set.name: converter
set.description:
An expression that specifies the Converter for this component. If the value binding expression is a String, the String is used as an ID to look up a Converter. If the value binding expression is a Converter, uses that instance as the converter.
The value can either be a static value (ID case only) or an EL expression.

set.description: A boolean value that identifies the phase during which value change events should fire. During normal event processing, value change events are fired during the "invoke application" phase of request processing. If this attribute is set to "true", these methods are fired instead at the end of the "apply request values" phase.

set.name: visibleOnUserRole
set.description: If user is in given role, this component will be rendered normally. If not, nothing is rendered and the body of this tag will be skipped.

set.name: displayValueOnly
set.description: If true, renders only the value of the component, but no input widget. Default is false.

set.name: displayValueOnlyStyle
set.description: Style used when displayValueOnly is true.

set.name: displayValueOnlyStyleClass
set.description: Style class used when displayValueOnly is true.

set.name: fallback
set.description: Use a text area instead of the javascript HTML editor. Default is false. Use with caution.

set.name: type
set.description: The type of the value. It can be either fragment for an HTML fragment (default) or document for a full HTML document, with head, title, body, ... tags.

set.name: allowEditSource
set.description: Allows the user to edit the HTML source code. Default is true.

set.name: allowExternalLinks
set.description: Allows the user to insert external links. Default is true.

set.name: addKupuLogo
set.description: Show the Kupu Logo in the buttons bar. Default is true.

set.name: showAllToolBoxes
set.description: Shortcut to avoid setting all the showXXToolBox to true. Default is false.

set.name: showPropertiesToolBox
set.description: Show the Properties tool box next to the text. Default is false.

set.name: showLinksToolBox
set.description: Show the Links tool box next to the text. Default is false.

set.name: showImagesToolBox
set.description: Show the Images tool box next to the text. Default is false.

set.name: showTablesToolBox

set.name: showCleanupExpressionsToolBox
set.description: Show the Cleanup Expressions tool box next to the text. Default is false.

set.name: showDebugToolBox
set.description: Show the Debug tool box next to the text. Default is false.

component.description:
A menu item. Used by navigationMenu, jscookMenu.
Unless otherwise specified, all attributes accept static values or EL expressions.

set.name: id
set.description: The developer-assigned ID of this component. The ID must be unique within the scope of the tag's enclosing naming container (e.g. h:form or f:subview). This value must be a static value.

set.name: itemDisabled
set.description: If true, this component will not be saved during state saving.

set.name: itemDescription
set.description: An optional description for this item.

set.name: itemLabel
set.description: The locale-specific label that will be displayed to the user for this item.

set.name: itemValue
set.description: The value of this item, of the same type as the parent component's value.

set.name: value
set.description: An EL expression that refers to a javax.faces.model.SelectItem instance.

set.name: enabledOnUserRole
set.description: If user is in given role, this component will be rendered normally. If not, no hyperlink is rendered but all nested tags (=body) are rendered.

set.name: visibleOnUserRole
set.description: If user is in given role, this component will be rendered normally. If not, nothing is rendered and the body of this tag will be skipped.

set.name: disabled
set.description: When set instead of a Hyperlink a span tag is rendered in the corresponding Component

set.name: disabledStyle
set.description: CSS-Style Attribute to render when disabled is true

set.name: disabledStyleClass
set.description: CSS-Style Class to use when disabled is true

component.description: A tree of menu items as returned by a value-expression. Unless otherwise specified, all attributes accept static values or EL expressions.

set.name: id
set.description: The developer-assigned ID of this component. The ID must be unique within the scope of the tag's enclosing naming container (e.g. h:form or f:subview). This value must be a static value.

set.name: value
set.description:
An EL expression that specifies the contents of the selection list. The expression can refer to one of the following:
  1. A single SelectItem
  2. An array or Collection of SelectItem instances
  3. A Map. The contents of the Map are used to create SelectItem instances, where the SelectItem's label is the map's key value, and the SelectItem's value is the map's value. When using a map, it is recommended that an ordered implementation such as java.util.TreeMap is used.
The value properties of each of the SelectItems must be of the same basic type as the parent component's value.

component.description:

Unless otherwise specified, all attributes accept static values or EL expressions.

set.name: id

set.description: An alternate location to find image resources. If no values is specified, images will be loaded from the resources directory using AddResource and ExtensionsFilter.

set.name: styleLocation
set.description: An alternate location to find stylesheet resources. If no values is specified, stylesheets will be loaded from the resources directory using AddResource and ExtensionsFilter.

set.name: immediate
set.description: A boolean value that identifies the phase during which action events should fire. During normal event processing, action methods and action listener methods are fired during the "invoke application" phase of request processing. If this attribute is set to "true", these methods are fired instead at the end of the "apply request values" phase.

set.description: Define the target media of the styles: <dl> <dt>screen</dt> <dd>Intended for non-paged computer screens.</dd> <dt>tty</dt> <dd>Intended for media using a fixed-pitch character grid, such as teletypes, terminals, or portable devices with limited display capabilities.</dd> <dt>tv</dt> <dd>Intended for television-type devices (low resolution, color, limited scrollability).</dd> <dt>projection</dt> <dd>Intended for projectors.</dd> <dt>handheld</dt> <dd>Intended for handheld devices (small screen, monochrome, bitmapped graphics, limited bandwidth).</dd> <dt>print</dt> <dd>Intended for paged, opaque material and for documents viewed on screen in print preview mode.</dd> <dt>braille</dt> <dd>Intended for braille tactile feedback devices.</dd> <dt>aural</dt> <dd>Intended for speech synthesizers.</dd> <dt>all</dt> <dd>Suitable for all devices.</dd> </dl> Could be a comma separated list. See also http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/types.html#type-media-descriptors

component.description:
Creates an arbitrary HTML tag which encloses any child components. The value attribute specifies the name of the generated tag.

If value is an empty string then no tag will be generated, but the child components will be rendered. This differs from setting rendered=false, which prevents child components from being rendered at all.

There is currently no facility for adding attributes to the generated html tag other than those explicitly supported by the attributes on this JSF component.

Unless otherwise specified, all attributes accept static values or EL expressions.

set.name: id
set.description: The developer-assigned ID of this component. The ID must be unique within the scope of the tag's enclosing naming container (e.g. h:form or f:subview). This value must be a static value.

set.description: If true, this component will force the use of the specified id when rendering.

set.name: forceIdIndex
set.description: If false, this component will not append a '[n]' suffix (where 'n' is the row index) to components that are contained within a "list." This value will be true by default and the value will be ignored if the value of forceId is false (or not specified.)

set.name: enabledOnUserRole
set.description: If user is in given role, this component will be rendered normally. If not, no hyperlink is rendered but all nested tags (=body) are rendered.

set.name: visibleOnUserRole
set.description: If user is in given role, this component will be rendered normally. If not, nothing is rendered and the body of this tag will be skipped.

set.name: value
set.description: The name of the tag. For example, use h1 to generate an h1 tag.

set.name: style
set.description: The style to use for this tag.

set.name: styleClass
set.description: The class to use for this tag.

component.description:
Renders a HTML input of type "radio". The associated SelectItem comes from an extended selectOneRadio component with layout "spread". The selectOneRadio is referenced by the "for" attribute. All HTML pass-through attributes for this input are taken from the associated selectOneRadio.
Unless otherwise specified, all attributes accept static values or EL expressions.

set.name: id
set.description: The developer-assigned ID of this component. The ID must be unique within the scope of the tag's enclosing naming container (e.g. h:form or f:subview). This value must be a static value.

set.name: enabledOnUserRole
set.description: If user is in given role, this component will be rendered normally. If not, no hyperlink is rendered but all nested tags (=body) are rendered.

set.name: visibleOnUserRole
set.description: If user is in given role, this component will be rendered normally. If not, nothing is rendered and the body of this tag will be skipped.

set.name: for
set.description: id of the referenced extended selectOneRadio component

set.name: index
set.description: n-th SelectItem of referenced UISelectOne starting with 0.

component.description:
Renders a HTML input of type "treeCheckbox". The associated comes from the treeCheckbox itemLabel and itemValue. The selected items come from an extended selectManyCheckbox component with layout "spread". The selectManyCheckbox is referenced by the "for" attribute. All HTML pass-through attributes for this input are taken from the associated selectManyCheckbox.
Unless otherwise specified, all attributes accept static values or EL expressions.

set.name: id
set.description: The developer-assigned ID of this component. The ID must be unique within the scope of the tag's enclosing naming container (e.g. h:form or f:subview). This value must be a static value.

set.name: itemDisabled
set.description: If true, this component will not be saved during state saving.

set.name: itemDescription
set.description: An optional description for this item.

set.name: itemLabel
set.description: The locale-specific label that will be displayed to the user for this item.

set.name: itemValue
set.description: The value of this item, of the same type as the parent component's value.

set.name: value
set.description: An EL expression that refers to a javax.faces.model.SelectItem instance.

set.name: for
set.description: id of the referenced extended selectManyCheckbox component

component.description:
A component that provides an HTML-based tree from data supplied by a backing bean. The tree is highly customizable and allows for fine-grained control over the appearance of each of the nodes depending on their type. Almost any type of JSF component (text, image, checkbox, etc.) can be rendered inside the nodes and there is an option for client-side or server-side toggling of the expand/collapse state.
Unless otherwise specified, all attributes accept static values or EL expressions.

set.name: showNav
set.description: Show the "plus" and "minus" navigation icons (default is true.) Value is ignored if clientSideToggle is true.

set.name: showLines
set.description: Show the connecting lines (default is true.)

set.name: clientSideToggle
set.description: Perform client-side toggling of expand/collapse state via javascript (default is true.)

set.name: showRootNode
set.description: Include the root node when rendering the tree (default is true.)

set.name: preserveToggle
set.description: Preserve changes in client-side toggle information between requests (default is true.)

set.name: javascriptLocation
set.description: An alternate location to find javascript resources. If no values is specified, javascript will be loaded from the resources directory using AddResource and ExtensionsFilter.

set.name: imageLocation
set.description: An alternate location to find image resources. If no values is specified, images will be loaded from the resources directory using AddResource and ExtensionsFilter.

set.name: styleLocation
set.description: An alternate location to find stylesheet resources. If no values is specified, stylesheets will be loaded from the resources directory using AddResource and ExtensionsFilter.

set.name: id
set.description: The developer-assigned ID of this component. The ID must be unique within the scope of the tag's enclosing naming container (e.g. h:form or f:subview). This value must be a static value.

component.description:

set.description: Pop the panel up in horizontal distance of x pixels from event.

set.description: Pop the panel up in vertical distance of y pixels from event.

set.name: closePopupOnExitingElement
set.description: Close the popup when the triggering element is left.

set.name: closePopupOnExitingPopup
set.description: Close the popup when the popup itself is left.

component.description:

set.name: columnClasses

set.name: footerClass

set.name: headerClass

set.name: rowClasses

set.description: HTML: The direction of text display, either 'ltr' (left-to-right) or 'rtl' (right-to-left).

set.description: HTML: The base language of this document.

set.description: HTML: CSS styling instructions.

set.name: align
set.description: HTML: Specifies the horizontal alignment of this element. Deprecated in HTML 4.01.

set.name: border
set.description: HTML: Specifies the width of the border of this element, in pixels. Deprecated in HTML 4.01.

set.name: bgcolor
set.description: HTML: The background color of this element.

set.name: datafld
set.description: Reserved for future use.

set.name: datasrc
set.description: Reserved for future use.

set.name: dataformatas
set.description: Reserved for future use.

set.name: cellpadding
set.description: HTML: Specifies the amount of empty space between the cell border and its contents. It can be either a pixel length or a percentage.

set.name: cellspacing
set.description: HTML: Specifies the amount of space between the cells of the table. It can be either a pixel length or a percentage of available space.

set.name: frame
set.description: HTML: Controls what part of the frame that surrounds a table is visible. Values include: void, above, below, hsides, lhs, rhs, vsides, box, and border.

set.name: rules
set.description: HTML: Controls how rules are rendered between cells. Values include: none, groups, rows, cols, and all.

set.name: summary
set.description: HTML: Provides a summary of the contents of the table, for accessibility purposes.

set.name: width
set.description: HTML: Specifies the desired width of the table, as a pixel length or a percentage of available space.

set.name: value
set.description:
An EL expression that specifies the data model that backs this table. The value can be of any type.
A value of type DataModel is used directly. Array-like parameters of type java.util.List, array of Object, java.sql.ResultSet, or javax.servlet.jsp.jstl.sql.Result are wrapped in a DataModel.
Other values are wrapped in a DataModel as a single row.

set.name: var
set.description: Defines the name of the request-scope variable that will hold the current row during iteration. This value must be a static value.

set.name: rows
set.description: The number of rows to be displayed. Specify zero for all remaining rows in the table.

set.name: first
set.description: The index of the first row to be displayed, where 0 is the first row.

set.name: newspaperColumns
set.description: The number of columns to wrap the table over. Default: 1

component.description:
A tag that defines a new bean (alias) with a given value. This allows you to design a subform with a generic (fictive) bean and to include it in all the pages where you use it. You just need to make an alias mapping the fictive bean name to the real bean before including the subform.

When used within an aliasBeansScope tag, this tag adds the alias to the aliasBeansScope. This makes configuration with multiple aliasBeans easier to write.

Unless otherwise specified, all attributes accept static values or EL expressions.

set.name: id
set.description: The developer-assigned ID of this component. The ID must be unique within the scope of the tag's enclosing naming container (e.g., h:form or f:subview). This value must be a static value.

set.name: alias
value
set.description: The existing value that the alias can be set to. This can be a literal string (like "toto") or a reference to an existing bean (like "#{myBean.member1}").

component.description:
This is like an aliasBean tag, but instead of the alias/value attributes, you configure the aliases by adding aliasBean tags in the body.
The aliasBeans should be declared right after this tag.
Unless otherwise specified, all attributes accept static values or EL expressions.

set.name: id
set.description: The developer-assigned ID of this component. The ID must be unique within the scope of the tag's enclosing naming container (e.g. h:form or f:subview). This value must be a static value.

component.description: Unless otherwise specified, all attributes accept static values or EL expressions.
Encapsulates the whole document. Equivalent to htmls <html> tag
Encapsulates the head of your document. Equivalent to htmls <head> tag
Encapsulates the body of your document. Equivalent to htmls <body> tag

saveState enables you to persist beans and values longer than request scope, but shorter than session scope. It is ideal for persisting backing beans and values with the same scope as your view components. It does this by saving the target state with the component tree.
Unless otherwise specified, all attributes accept static values or EL expressions.

set.name: id
set.description: The developer-assigned ID of this component. The ID must be unique within the scope of the tag's enclosing naming container (e.g. h:form or f:subview). This value must be a static value.

component.description:
Registers an org.apache.myfaces.custom.updateactionlistener.UpdateActionListener at the parent component (which must be an ActionSource). When the parent's action fires the specified value is evaluated, then written into the specified property.
Unless otherwise specified, all attributes accept static values or EL expressions.

set.name: property
set.description: A value-binding that specifies a property to be updated when the parent's action occurs.

set.name: value
set.description: A literal value or value-binding that specifies what will be assigned to the destination specified by the property attribute.

set.name: converter
set.description: The name of a registered Converter object which will be invoked to convert the value into an appropriate datatype for assigning to the specified property. If not specified then an appropriate converter will be selected automatically.
